messages.title: Getting stuff done for Bristol North West!
messages.content: 1. RE-OPEN OUR RAILWAYS! - Thanks to Charlotte's campaign, Henbury Station WILL re-open. But we need it before, not after new Cribbs development gridlock. 2. LAMPLIGHTERS PUB OPEN, NOW A FERRY... - After Charlotte's pub campaign, the Lamplighters Pub re-opened. Now we want to bring back a Shire-Pill ferry on occasions. 3. EVEN BETTER SCHOOLS - Charlotte instigated setting up The Bristol Free School, Bristol schools are getting ever-better. But still more to do - like a Royal College of Teaching.

messages.title: About Charlotte Leslie
messages.content: The daughter of local surgeon, Ian Leslie, Charlotte has grown up in, and out of, the NHS. Fighting for a free NHS forever: local surgeon's daughter Charlotte won a national award championing the NHS.

messages.title: Let's re-open our railways
messages.content: Abominable buses; gridlocked roads; blanket 20mph zones... Bristol transport is at a standstill. And with thousands of houses to be built at Cribbs and Filton...we'll get much more of the same, before a station at Henbury! We need it NOW - before the commuter suburbs are even more gridlocked. We won't let Henbury Station wait for a new development to spend any more money, we want action now, to decongest and clean our air. Action, not gridlock.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Re-opening Henbury Station before the new Cribbs development to alleviate traffic and prevent further gridlock.
Instigated the re-opening of Lamplighters Pub and aiming to bring back a Shire-Pill ferry.
Supporting better education by setting up The Bristol Free School and advocating for more improvements, such as a Royal College of Teaching.

issues.education: Charlotte instigated setting up The Bristol Free School, Bristol schools are getting ever-better.
issues.governance: Promises action to alleviate traffic and improve infrastructure ahead of housing developments.
issues.health: Fighting for a free NHS forever: local surgeon's daughter Charlotte won a national award championing the NHS.

housing.content: With thousands of houses to be built at Cribbs and Filton, there is concern about increased gridlock and the need for improved transport infrastructure before development.

leaflet.personalStatement: "I get frustrated by politics. But that's why I'm in it - to make the places we love better. My motto? 'Be the Change you want to see!'"

images.caption: Making a splash: Charlotte's campaign saves club learn-to-swim
They said we couldn't do it: Historic Lamplighters Pub re-opens!
